headline: Marriott finance chief Leeny Oberg to retire next year
summary: The company has appointed insider Jen Mason as Oberg's successor.  Oberg has been Marriott's CFO since 2016, helping navigate the challenges posed by the COVID-19 pandemic and spearheading its cost initiatives.  Mason joined Marriott in 1992 and currently serves as the global officer, treasurer and risk management.

headline: Marriott International Announces Retirement of Leeny Oberg, Chief Financial Officer and EVP, Development, in 2026
summary: Marriott International (Nasdaq: MAR) today announced that after 26 years with the company, Leeny Oberg, Marriott's Chief Financial Officer and Executive Vice President, Development, has decided to retire effective March 31, 2026. Two long-time Marriott veterans have been named her successors. Next year, Jen Mason will become the company's Chief Financial Officer and Shawn Hill will take on the role of Chief Development Officer.

headline: An Unforgettable Island Escape for Music Lovers: Discover the "Concert Getaway" at San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino
summary: As Puerto Rico prepares to welcome one of the most exciting music seasons of the year, the San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino invites music lovers to embrace the celebration in style with the launch of its exclusive Concert Getaway package — the perfect way to enjoy a cultural escape with all the comforts of a beachfront resort. Enhancing the season's offerings, Marriott Bonvoy Members can also bid on an unforgettable No Me Quiero Ir de Aquí Concert Experience through Marriott Bonvoy Mo

headline: HHM Hotels restructures leadership team
summary: The move is intended to boost “scalable growth” in the U.S. and Canada, the Philadelphia-based hospitality management firm shared.

headline: 1 Mooning  Stock with Competitive Advantages and 2 to Ignore
summary: Exciting developments are taking place for the stocks in this article. They’ve all surged ahead of the broader market over the last month as catalysts such as new products and positive media coverage have propelled their returns.

headline: 3 S&P 500 Stocks in Hot Water
summary: The S&P 500 (^GSPC) is home to the biggest and most well-known companies in the market, making it a go-to index for investors seeking stability. But not all large-cap stocks are created equal - some are struggling with slowing growth, declining margins, or increased competition.
